Docs.param: The ID of the resource.
The name of the resource.
The type of the resource.
The ETag of the resource, used for concurrency statements.
The display name for the pool.
The last modified time of the pool.
The creation time of the pool.
The current state of the pool.
The time at which the pool entered its current state.
Whether the pool is resizing.
The time at which the pool entered its current allocation state.
The size of virtual machines in the pool. All VMs in a pool are the same size.
This property describes how the pool nodes will be deployed - using Cloud Services or Virtual Machines.
The number of compute nodes currently in the pool.
The number of low priority compute nodes currently in the pool.
Settings which configure the number of nodes in the pool.
The results and errors from the last execution of the autoscale formula.
Whether the pool permits direct communication between nodes.
The network configuration for the pool.
The maximum number of tasks that can run concurrently on a single compute node in the pool.
How tasks are distributed across compute nodes in a pool.
The list of user accounts to be created on each node in the pool.
A list of name-value pairs associated with the pool as metadata.
A task specified to run on each compute node as it joins the pool.
The list of certificates to be installed on each compute node in the pool.
The list of application packages to be installed on each compute node in the pool.
The list of application licenses the Batch service will make available on each compute node in the pool.
Contains details about the current or last completed resize operation.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Pool class.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property AllocationState As Nullable(Of AllocationState)

Docs.summary: Gets whether the pool is resizing.
Docs.remarks:
Values are:
Steady - The pool is not resizing. There are no changes to the number of nodes in the pool in progress. A pool enters this state when it is created and when no operations are being performed on the pool to change the number of dedicated nodes. Resizing - The pool is resizing; that is, compute nodes are being added to or removed from the pool. Stopping - The pool was resizing, but the user has requested that the resize be stopped, but the stop request has not yet been completed. Possible values include: 'Steady', 'Resizing', 'Stopping'

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property AllocationStateTransitionTime As Nullable(Of DateTime)
public: property Nullable<DateTime> AllocationStateTransitionTime { Nullable<DateTime> get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the time at which the pool entered its current allocation state.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property ApplicationLicenses As IList(Of String)
member this.ApplicationLicenses : System.Collections.Generic.IList<string> with get, set

public: property System::Collections::Generic::IList<System::String ^> ^ ApplicationLicenses { System::Collections::Generic::IList<System::String ^> ^ get(); void set(System::Collections::Generic::IList<System::String ^> ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the list of application licenses the Batch service will make available on each compute node in the pool.
Docs.remarks: The list of application licenses must be a subset of available Batch service application licenses. If a license is requested which is not supported, pool creation will fail.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property ApplicationPackages As IList(Of ApplicationPackageReference)

public: property System::Collections::Generic::IList<Microsoft::Azure::Management::Batch::Models::ApplicationPackageReference ^> ^ ApplicationPackages { System::Collections::Generic::IList<Microsoft::Azure::Management::Batch::Models::ApplicationPackageReference ^> ^ get(); void set(System::Collections::Generic::IList<Microsoft::Azure::Management::Batch::Models::ApplicationPackageReference ^> ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the list of application packages to be installed on each compute node in the pool.
Docs.remarks: Changes to application packages affect all new compute nodes joining the pool, but do not affect compute nodes that are already in the pool until they are rebooted or reimaged.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property AutoScaleRun As AutoScaleRun

Docs.summary: Gets the results and errors from the last execution of the autoscale formula.
Docs.remarks: This property is set only if the pool automatically scales, i.e. autoScaleSettings are used.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property Certificates As IList(Of CertificateReference)

public: property System::Collections::Generic::IList<Microsoft::Azure::Management::Batch::Models::CertificateReference ^> ^ Certificates { System::Collections::Generic::IList<Microsoft::Azure::Management::Batch::Models::CertificateReference ^> ^ get(); void set(System::Collections::Generic::IList<Microsoft::Azure::Management::Batch::Models::CertificateReference ^> ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the list of certificates to be installed on each compute node in the pool.
Docs.remarks: For Windows compute nodes, the Batch service installs the certificates to the specified certificate store and location. For Linux compute nodes, the certificates are stored in a directory inside the task working directory and an environment variable AZ_BATCH_CERTIFICATES_DIR is supplied to the task to query for this location. For certificates with visibility of 'remoteUser', a 'certs' directory is created in the user's home directory (e.g., /home/{user-name}/certs) and certificates are placed in that directory.

public: property Nullable<DateTime> CreationTime { Nullable<DateTime> get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the creation time of the pool.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property CurrentDedicatedNodes As Nullable(Of Integer)
public: property Nullable<int> CurrentDedicatedNodes { Nullable<int> get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of compute nodes currently in the pool.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property CurrentLowPriorityNodes As Nullable(Of Integer)
public: property Nullable<int> CurrentLowPriorityNodes { Nullable<int> get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of low priority compute nodes currently in the pool.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Azure::Management::Batch::Models::DeploymentConfiguration ^ DeploymentConfiguration { Microsoft::Azure::Management::Batch::Models::DeploymentConfiguration ^ get(); void set(Microsoft::Azure::Management::Batch::Models::DeploymentConfiguration ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets this property describes how the pool nodes will be deployed - using Cloud Services or Virtual Machines.
Docs.remarks: Using CloudServiceConfiguration specifies that the nodes should be creating using Azure Cloud Services (PaaS), while VirtualMachineConfiguration uses Azure Virtual Machines (IaaS).

MemberSignature.Value: member this.DisplayName : string with get, set
public: property System::String ^ DisplayName { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
public: property Platform::String ^ DisplayName { Platform::String ^ get(); void set(Platform::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the display name for the pool.
Docs.remarks: The display name need not be unique and can contain any Unicode characters up to a maximum length of 1024.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property InterNodeCommunication As Nullable(Of InterNodeCommunicationState)

public: property Nullable<Microsoft::Azure::Management::Batch::Models::InterNodeCommunicationState> InterNodeCommunication { Nullable<Microsoft::Azure::Management::Batch::Models::InterNodeCommunicationState> get(); void set(Nullable<Microsoft::Azure::Management::Batch::Models::InterNodeCommunicationState> value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets whether the pool permits direct communication between nodes.
Docs.remarks: This imposes restrictions on which nodes can be assigned to the pool. Enabling this value can reduce the chance of the requested number of nodes to be allocated in the pool. If not specified, this value defaults to 'Disabled'. Possible values include: 'Enabled', 'Disabled'

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property LastModified As Nullable(Of DateTime)
public: property Nullable<DateTime> LastModified { Nullable<DateTime> get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the last modified time of the pool.
Docs.remarks: This is the last time at which the pool level data, such as the targetDedicatedNodes or autoScaleSettings, changed. It does not factor in node-level changes such as a compute node changing state.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property MaxTasksPerNode As Nullable(Of Integer)
member this.MaxTasksPerNode : Nullable<int> with get, set
public: property Nullable<int> MaxTasksPerNode { Nullable<int> get(); void set(Nullable<int> value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of tasks that can run concurrently on a single compute node in the pool.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property Metadata As IList(Of MetadataItem)

public: property System::Collections::Generic::IList<Microsoft::Azure::Management::Batch::Models::MetadataItem ^> ^ Metadata { System::Collections::Generic::IList<Microsoft::Azure::Management::Batch::Models::MetadataItem ^> ^ get(); void set(System::Collections::Generic::IList<Microsoft::Azure::Management::Batch::Models::MetadataItem ^> ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a list of name-value pairs associated with the pool as metadata.
Docs.remarks: The Batch service does not assign any meaning to metadata; it is solely for the use of user code.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Azure::Management::Batch::Models::NetworkConfiguration ^ NetworkConfiguration { Microsoft::Azure::Management::Batch::Models::NetworkConfiguration ^ get(); void set(Microsoft::Azure::Management::Batch::Models::NetworkConfiguration ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the network configuration for the pool.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ProvisioningState As Nullable(Of PoolProvisioningState)

Docs.summary: Gets the current state of the pool.
Docs.remarks:
Values are:
Succeeded - The pool is available to run tasks subject to the availability of compute nodes. Deleting - The user has requested that the pool be deleted, but the delete operation has not yet completed. Possible values include: 'Succeeded', 'Deleting'

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ProvisioningStateTransitionTime As Nullable(Of DateTime)
public: property Nullable<DateTime> ProvisioningStateTransitionTime { Nullable<DateTime> get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the time at which the pool entered its current state.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ResizeOperationStatus As ResizeOperationStatus

Docs.summary: Gets contains details about the current or last completed resize operation.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Azure::Management::Batch::Models::ScaleSettings ^ ScaleSettings { Microsoft::Azure::Management::Batch::Models::ScaleSettings ^ get(); void set(Microsoft::Azure::Management::Batch::Models::ScaleSettings ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets settings which configure the number of nodes in the pool.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Azure::Management::Batch::Models::StartTask ^ StartTask { Microsoft::Azure::Management::Batch::Models::StartTask ^ get(); void set(Microsoft::Azure::Management::Batch::Models::StartTask ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a task specified to run on each compute node as it joins the pool.
Docs.remarks: In an PATCH (update) operation, this property can be set to an empty object to remove the start task from the pool.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Azure::Management::Batch::Models::TaskSchedulingPolicy ^ TaskSchedulingPolicy { Microsoft::Azure::Management::Batch::Models::TaskSchedulingPolicy ^ get(); void set(Microsoft::Azure::Management::Batch::Models::TaskSchedulingPolicy ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets how tasks are distributed across compute nodes in a pool.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property UserAccounts As IList(Of UserAccount)

public: property System::Collections::Generic::IList<Microsoft::Azure::Management::Batch::Models::UserAccount ^> ^ UserAccounts { System::Collections::Generic::IList<Microsoft::Azure::Management::Batch::Models::UserAccount ^> ^ get(); void set(System::Collections::Generic::IList<Microsoft::Azure::Management::Batch::Models::UserAccount ^> ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the list of user accounts to be created on each node in the pool.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Validate() cil managed
abstract member Validate : unit -> unit override this.Validate : unit -> unit

Docs.summary: Validate the object.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.VmSize : string with get, set
public: property System::String ^ VmSize { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
public: property Platform::String ^ VmSize { Platform::String ^ get(); void set(Platform::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the size of virtual machines in the pool. All VMs in a pool are the same size.
Docs.remarks: For information about available sizes of virtual machines for Cloud Services pools (pools created with cloudServiceConfiguration), see Sizes for Cloud Services (http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/cloud-services-sizes-specs/). Batch supports all Cloud Services VM sizes except ExtraSmall. For information about available VM sizes for pools using images from the Virtual Machines Marketplace (pools created with virtualMachineConfiguration) see Sizes for Virtual Machines (Linux) (https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/virtual-machines-linux-sizes/) or Sizes for Virtual Machines (Windows) (https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/virtual-machines-windows-sizes/). Batch supports all Azure VM sizes except STANDARD_A0 and those with premium storage (STANDARD_GS, STANDARD_DS, and STANDARD_DSV2 series).
